Title: Junior Data Scientist - Global Portfolio Management
Description:
Prima is an Italian tech company that has been disrupting the insurance industry since its launch in 2015, achieving a € 100 million investment from Goldman Sachs and Blackstone in 2018. Prima now boasts over two and a half million active clients and has started its international expansion, opening new offices in the UK and in Spain.

Our mission is to become Europe's best motor insurance provider. Analytics applied to Pricing and Underwriting is one of the main levers to do so: the decisions on prices and product immediately affect the growth and the business sustainability, as well as the protection guaranteed to our customers in case of adverse events.

In order to handle the new complexity of being a Global enterprise, we need to build an effective system for the coherent management of different portfolios, so to help each country in identifying as early as possible new opportunities for becoming even better and allow the headquarter to coordinate the definition and the implementation of the Pricing and Underwriting strategy.

Specifically, you will take care of these tasks:

Define and support the implementation in each country of the key monitoring tools to understand how the business is growing, for example, conversion, retention, emerging profitability. The monitoring tools need to be consistent at a global level and at the same time able to adapt to the different stage of evolution of each country.
Support the countries in planning the pricing and UW strategy and consequent follow up.
Bring constructive support in rate making, also leveraging on experiences matured in other countries.
Collaborate closely with the local teams of Pricing and Underwriting, ensuring a continuous link among them and sharing of ideas.


Requirements

You are our ideal candidate if you meet these requirements:

Degree in Actuarial Science, Mathematics, Physics or equivalent STEM.
Grad student or experience of at most 2 years in a similar analytical role.
Ability to program in Python and know the main data analysis and machine learning libraries (such as Pandas, Numpy, Scipy, XGBoost, Keras, TensorFlow).
Excellent logical and analytical acumen.
Ability to work in an international environment.
A natural tendency to challenge constructively the status quo.



In addition to the basic requirements, we will carefully evaluate these characteristics:

Knowledge of SQL to create datasets.
Knowledge of BI tools (Tableau or similar).


Benefits

We will give you all you need to express your talent and work at your best:

Innovative and informal workplace.
Latest generation devices and tools.
Constant training (internal and external).
Welfare and company benefits.
Team building events.
We will evaluate salary and contract terms during the interview, in order to ensure you an offer adequate to your experience and to your competence.

The employment is Full Time.

Our office is in Piazzale Loreto 17, 20131 Milano (MI), but we also consider Full Remote hiring from other European countries and for our offices in Rome, London and Madrid.




Prima is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace. The company prohibits discrimination of any kind based on race, colour, sex, religion, sexual orientation, nationality, disability, genetic information, pregnancy, or any other protected characteristic as outlined by national laws.

Title: Data Scientist, Growth & Analytics
Description:
Smile Identity builds trust.

Smile Identity is Africa's leading digital KYC and Identification provider. We're building the tools that make it easier for millions of Africans to prove their identity online, anywhere they are in the world.

Our products are used by our partners across a wide range of industries such as Banking, Fintech, Social Welfare, Telecoms, and the Shared Economy. We are backed by US and African investors including Costanoa, CRE, Future Africa, Susa Ventures, and Vinod Khosla.

Our team is diverse, spanning 5 offices, 10 countries and 8 time zones. We believe in truth, hard work, fun, and ownership. Every Smiler has the intellectual freedom and autonomy to do their best work. We'd love for you to come with us on this amazing journey!

The Role

We are looking for a Data Scientist to join our Growth & Analytics department. Someone who thrives at leveraging data to solve problems.

The ideal candidate will have a strong analytical background, and has the ambition to make companies grow, regardless of the 'how'. Being very comfortable with data, you will drive the analytical insight necessary to understand our products and customers' needs to maximize impact, while figuring out how to get things done without relying on others to do the job.

You are familiar with structuring problems with data, understanding how to measure performance, and uncovering opportunities to improve products, the business, and the company. You are detail-oriented, enjoy empowering teams with data, and can rapidly earn trust and credibility with stakeholders. This person will be asked to demonstrate leadership, strategic thinking, and executional excellence.

Responsibilities:
Define and analyze metrics that inform the success of our products and business, allowing us to monitor the health of our activities.
Develop data centric strategies and frameworks to deliver value, whether it's driving acquisition programs, supporting product go-to-market activities, or providing product insights for customers.
Understand funnels, user behaviours, and trends in the adoption of our products to identify opportunities for step-changes and angle changes in growth.
Apply your expertise in quantitative analysis, data mining, and the presentation of data to see beyond the numbers and understand how our customers interact with our products.
Empower stakeholders with data to support growth and expansion initiatives.
Suggest improvements to the data models and logging where you see opportunities.
Analyze and communicate results in order to rapidly scale successful programs and learnings.

Requirements:
3+ years of experience with SQL, quantitative analysis experience, Tableau or other data visualization tools
3-5 years of experience as a Data Analyst, Data Scientist or Data Engineer, or hands-on experience analyzing and interpreting data, drawing conclusions, defining recommended actions, and reporting results across stakeholders
A proactive "can-do" attitude, with the ability to work autonomously, managing, prioritising and delivering multiple projects in a fast-paced, cross-functional environment
A proactive communication style; you do not shy away from speaking up and sharing your ideas in bigger group settings and an executive level
Strong project management skills with an ability to prioritize according to highest business impact

Successes in your first 3 months include:
Develop expertise and familiarity with company data sets, tools, dashboards, and metrics methodologies.
Deliver time-sensitive analyses at the right time to support stakeholders in making critical decisions.
Understand the performance of all existing products and business activities, and come up with 1-2 actionable suggestions of what is working well and what needs to be improved.

In your first 6 months
By now you should be familiar with the company data sets and tools, enabling you to proactively develop metrics to inform product and business strategies.
You are able to suggest improvements to our data infrastructure or new / better ways to measure our existing metrics.
You are able to independently uncover new opportunities to improve our products & the business and influence teams to adopt your suggestions.

In your first 12 months
You can be tasked with structuring a data-centric strategy to tackle new business problems / product opportunities.
You can be called an expert for all things data related to a specific product / business area matching your interest and where we want to double down as a company.
You are a thought leader in defining how we would measure success in your product / business area.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Beeswax’s mission is to build great advertising software. Our product is an easy to use, massive scale and high availability advertising platform founded by industry veterans who worked together at Google. We offer our customers the most extensible and transparent advertising system in the world and process billions of transactions per second.

We are looking for a Machine Learning Engineer with an in-depth working knowledge of the latest in Machine Learning/Data Science technologies and cloud platforms to join our Optimization team.

In this role you’ll work on a wide range of computational challenges such as: CTR prediction, forecasting, bidding models, and delivery optimization. We practice an effective data science process that recognizes the uncertainty in explorations for ML solutions but also emphasizes an agile software engineering workflow. We use the most popular tools in the Python data science ecosystem and embrace innovation.

Our tech stack is always evolving to meet the challenges of the massive scale of transactions on which we operate. To manage the firehose of data coming in, we explore complex tradeoffs and carefully architect high performance distributed systems. Those in turn require elegant and thoughtfully designed interfaces to make the systems accessible to both our team and our customers.

Responsibilities
Contribute to data science projects and ensure they deliver business value
Work with the Product and Engineering team to build data model pipelines to power customer-driven products
Implement and test the latest research works
Essential Qualifications
BSc or above in a STEM (science, technology, engineering, mathematics) subject
2+ years of demonstrable experience with Machine Learning/Data Science
Efficient in Python and SQL
Good understanding of engineering best practices, agile (in Data Science) and version control
Experience with out-of-core algorithms
Effective collaboration with Product, Commercial team and Engineering team
Desired Qualifications
Strong understanding and experience in distributed ML frameworks, especially in Tensorflow
Practical experience with Data Warehousing, especially Snowflake
Practical experience with ML Platforms (e.g., AWS SageMaker, Kubeflow)
Excellent academic or industrial track record
Knowledge of the latest Machine Learning/Data Science technologies and cloud platforms (especially AWS)
More About Beeswax
Beeswax was founded in 2014 and was acquired by Comcast’s FreeWheel in 2021.
Comcast NBCUniversal was named #21 on Fortune’s Best Companies to Work For in 2021 and #4 on Fortune’s 100 Best Big Companies to Work For list.

Title: Educator, Data Scientist
Description:
About The Role

BrainStation is a global leader in digital skills training and development, offering a 12-week bootcamp program in Data Science. BrainStation is currently hiring a Data Science professional to teach our program through online and in-person teaching. BrainStation Educators are given the unique opportunity to teach, research, and further develop their skills, while teaching in a dynamic, project-based setting.

Responsibilities
Teach our 12-week Data Science Diploma program
Help build a world class technical team passionate about designing and teaching
Deliver lectures and provide expert technical guidance to students who are building exciting projects using the most cutting-edge technologies
Facilitate in-class activities, group discussions, demos and mentor the next wave of emerging talent
Co-create BrainStation's curriculum that will positively impact the lives and careers of hundreds of individuals across our campuses
Actively work on writing and researching new content to teach the most up to date design skills to our students
Apply BrainStation's "Agile Education" methodologies to the program to continuously improve the educational experience for students
Constantly improve your own skills and apply these skills in collaboration with other BrainStation Educators in order to build the digital platform and tools needed to effectively deliver educational material
Define the education experience of the future

Requirements
3-5+ years experience as a Data Scientist or Analytics professional and a Bachelor's degree relevant to the subject matter OR 8+ years work experience in the vocation
Strong command of querying and programming languages (SQL, R and python - numpy, pandas, sklearn, TensorFlow & Keras), and visualization tools (Excel, Tableau, matplotlib/seaborn/plotly in python packages
Experience applying various methods of numerical and categorical modelling techniques and supervised and unsupervised machine learning methods (OLS regression and GLMs, logistic regression, KNN, SVM, decision trees/random forest, clustering and cluster analysis, dimensionality reduction, neural networks)
Hands-on development experience working with version control systems (we use Git) and Big Data and Cloud platforms (Hadoop, Spark, Amazon Web Services (AWS), Google Cloud (GCP)) a strong asset regression and machine learning principles
Practical experience designing and applying data science processes to conduct experiments using a variety of tools and methods, and can speak to their complexities in a simple and logical manner
Experience building and leading technical teams
Experience in a teaching role, and are comfortable speaking to large groups and mentoring others on the job
A strong work ethic with the utmost integrity and desire to excel and succeed
An empathetic, inclusive, enthusiastic personality, and is someone who enjoys helping others and facilitating learning
A passion for teaching and mentoring others and creating positive learning experiences

Perks And Benefits
Comprehensive Health & Wellness Benefits Package
Retirement Planning
Parental Leave Program
New Device Allowance
Socials, Outings & Retreats
Culture of Learning & Development
Flexible Working Hours
Work from Home Flexibility

About BrainStation

Established in 2012, BrainStation is the global leader in digital skills training and workforce transformation. BrainStation has worked with digital leaders from the most innovative companies in the world, developing cutting-edge, real-world digital education that has empowered more than 100,000+ professionals.

Bonus: Have you been to a campus or joined an online learning opportunity? We are actively seeking individuals that believe in lifelong learning and that have taken part in our On Campus or Online offerings.

NOTE: Only those applicants under consideration will be contacted. Please accept our utmost appreciation for your interest.

BrainStation is committed to maintaining a diverse work environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants, regardless of race, colour, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status will receive consideration for employment. If you have any accessibility requirements or concerns regarding the hiring process or employment with us, please notify us so we can provide suitable accommodation.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
___________________________________________________________

Machine Learning Engineer

I’m currently recruiting on behalf of a fast growing, London based medical technologies start-up. Receiving multiple awards and a great round of funding, my client use Cloud based Machine Learning platforms to monitor and predict cancer. They are paving the way for improved patient outcomes, better patient experiences and increased value for healthcare providers. Currently at 25 people, they want to double in size within the next 6 months and are hoping they can scale their machine learning team.

This role will form a core part of their Machine Learning engineering team, and will be working alongside R&D Scientists/Engineers. Working on Computer Vision models and with neural networks will form a large part of your day to day. You’ll be building scalable data pipelines, working alongside the MLOps engineers and be helping to make sure the ML models built are reproducible, reliable and secure. You should be familiar with state-of-the-art ML technology and software development methodologies and be able to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment. You should have a passion for technology, healthcare and improving the lives of others.

This role is paying between £65,000 - £85,000, with flex for the right person. My client have created a culture of forward thinking, passionate and supportive professionals, and are happy for people work remotely, as long as they can occasionally get to London. They provide a good benefits package and are always looking to help up-skill people.

Degree, Masters or Higher in a Computer Science, Software Engineering/Related degree program
3+ Years’ experience working on Machine Learning models in a commercial environment
Demonstrable experience of Computer vision understanding and associated tools
Hands on Python, PyTorch, TensorFlow/Keras experience and knowledge of either AWS/Azure/GCP
Understanding of MLOps frameworks and platforms + associated software engineering methodologies

Then please get in touch. This is a truly fantastic role for someone looking to join a start-up in the early stages of their journey and ultimately join a team pushing the boundaries of technology. Get in touch with Kieran Haynes to find out more.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer (Principal)
Description:
WovenLight's vision is to inject data and analytics into both the core of value creation at portfolio companies, and how we ourselves operate as an investment firm. To execute our mission we are building an integrated team of world class investment, operating and technology professionals. If you are excited about working with us to build the next generation private equity firm we would love to hear from you.

As a Principal Machine Learning Engineer, you will lead the development of technical solutions that help WovenLight create value across its portfolio. You will play a key role on individual projects for portfolio companies, as well as contributing to investment tools that underpin our approach across the investment lifecycle.

You will lead teams through the design, development and deployment of machine learning systems into production, being responsible for architecture, code quality and engineering design. You will balance hands-on work with team leadership responsibilities depending on the context of the specific project.

Examples of projects you could work on include:

Optimisation modelling to improve manufacturing throughput
Predictive modelling to anticipate/avoid asset downtime
Predicting and reducing customer churn
Identifying next best action for sales agents
Geospatial modelling to improve store footprint

Our internal investment tools use multiple data sources and ML algorithms to help our investment team improve the sourcing and selection of new portfolio companies.

You will work on these projects in integrated teams of technical and business-facing colleagues, while also collaborating with our investment team. You will apply a combination of leadership skills and deep technical expertise in data, infrastructure, ML algorithms and software engineering to deliver high quality technical solutions. You will also be involved to the alignment of scope, distribution of tasks, estimation of timelines and tracking of progress across the lifetime of the projects.

You will act as line manager for more junior WovenLight engineers, being responsible for coaching and mentoring them. You will also support our portfolio companies as they build and scale their ML teams internally. You should be comfortable giving and receiving feedback, as well as helping set personal development objectives.

The successful candidate should have the following attributes:

Passion and expertise in developing, deploying and monitoring ML algorithms to deliver commercial impact – ideally 6+ years of experience
Experience coaching and managing engineers
Excellent communication skills - able to explain complex analytical concepts to people from other fields
Expertise in Python and a deep knowledge of the Python ML stack (e.g. numpy, pandas, scikit-learn, pytorch / tensorflow))
Experience in the full development lifecycle of APIs, containerised (micro-)services, SDKs, and CLIs
Experience with one or more of the following tools & technologies:
Cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure or GCP
Data pipelining frameworks (e.g. Airflow, Kedro),
MLOps platforms (e.g. Databricks, Kubeflow, GCP Vertex)
Databases and data processing languages & tools, e.g. SQL (py-)Spark

Our core team is based in London. Interviews for this role will be conducted via a combination of phone, video-conference and in person.

WovenLight is committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of sex, race, religion, ethnicity, nationality, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other basis as protected by applicable law.
